## RouteSpec type

RouteSpec wraps a RefSpec with routing metadata Uses true wrapper pattern - delegates to internal RefSpec via closure Status is ONLY STATUS\_ROUTE\_SPEC (32) - not combined with STATUS\_REF\_SPEC The wrapped RefSpec is kept internal and accessed via delegation

Note: Does not extend RefSpec to avoid status type conflict. Instead, provides same create type through delegation.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export type RouteSpec<TElement> = {
    status: typeof STATUS_ROUTE_SPEC;
    routeMetadata: RouteMetadata<AdapterConfig>;
    unwrap(): RefSpec<TElement>;
    create<TExt = Record<string, unknown>>(svc?: unknown, extensions?: TExt): import('@lattice/view/types').NodeRef<TElement> & TExt;
};
```
**References:** [STATUS\_ROUTE\_SPEC](../status_route_spec/)<!-- -->, [RouteMetadata](../routemetadata/)<!-- -->, [AdapterConfig](../../view/adapterconfig/)<!-- -->, [RefSpec](../../view/refspec/)<!-- -->, [NodeRef](../../view/noderef/)
